sections.title: How I Show Up When It's Hard

q01.title: Current Relationship Status
q01.prompt: To be fully honest right here: Are you completely single right now—legally, emotionally, and in your heart?
examples: Yes (e.g., legally and emotionally free to date).
Separated (e.g., in process but living apart).

options.label: Yes—no marriage, separation, or complicated situation
It's complicated (there's overlap I should explain)

q02.title: Time Since Last Major Relationship
q02.prompt: Give me a quick snapshot of your relationship history—this helps us understand where you're coming from.
examples: Time: 6 months. Major: lived together. Ended: mutual.
Time: 2 years. Major: engaged. Ended: they left.

fields.label: Months since your last major relationship ended
What makes a relationship 'major' to you? (1 sentence)
Anything that affects how you're entering this?

q03.title: Ex Entanglement Check
q03.prompt: If you're being completely honest with yourself: Is there any ongoing connection with an ex (or someone else) that could affect your availability to show up fully in this?
examples: Processing (e.g., still think about them often).

q04.title: Emotional Closure
q04.prompt: When you think about your most recent ex, what's the dominant feeling that comes up—even if it's subtle?
examples: Neutral (e.g., I wish them well but have moved on).
Mixed (e.g., grateful for good times, glad it ended).

options.label: Warm / grateful for what we had

q05.title: Relational Safety
q05.prompt: Right now, do you feel physically and emotionally safe from any current partner, ex, or person you're dating? (No harassment, threats, stalking, or control.)

options.label: No—I feel unsafe, pressured, or threatened

q06.title: What Drew You to Them
q06.prompt: What specifically drew you to this person? (Not just 'we matched' or 'they're attractive.' Be honest about both the surface-level and the deeper pull.)
examples: Primary: Chemistry. Pattern: Familiar (reminds me of ex).

fields.label: The primary thing that drew you in

options.label: Good timing / I was ready / lonely
Genuine curiosity about who they are
They pursued me and it felt good

fields.label: Describe what drew you in—both surface-level and deeper
Does this attraction feel familiar in concerning ways?

options.label: Yes—I see a pattern I'm trying not to repeat

q07.title: Honest Motivation Check
q07.prompt: What's really pulling you toward exploring this right now? Select and rank your top reasons—be honest, even if some of them aren't 'noble.
examples: Top Reasons: 1) Genuine connection, 2) Values alignment. Urgency: Low.
Top Reasons: 1) Loneliness, 2) Physical attraction. Urgency: High.

options.label: We seem aligned on important things
I feel ready for real partnership
Fear of running out of time (age, kids, life stage)
Proving something to myself or someone else
Distraction from pain, grief, or boredom
They pursued me and it felt good
I just don't want to be alone

fields.label: How urgent does exploring this feel right now?
How confident are you that your motivation is healthy?
Anything you want to acknowledge here?

q08.title: If This Doesn't Work Out
q08.prompt: If this doesn't work out, what's your honest, likely reaction? (Not how you want to react—how you probably would.)
examples: Move on (e.g., I'd be sad but recover).

options.label: I'd process it and move on gracefully
I'd be crushed / might spiral a bit
It depends entirely on how it ends

q09.title: Early Momentum Check
q09.prompt: Right now, who seems more invested or leaning in? (This affects pacing and expectations—be honest.)
examples: Me more (e.g., I initiate most texts).
Them more (e.g., they are pursuing me hard).

q10.title: Pattern Recognition
q10.prompt: What pattern from your past relationships might show up here? (The one you keep repeating even though you know better.)
examples: I tend to over-give to earn love.
I withdraw when I feel criticized.
I ignore red flags because the chemistry is high.

q11.title: Dealbreakers You Need to Know
q11.prompt: What are your absolute non-negotiables—things about them that would end this before it starts? Select and rank your top 5.
examples: Top Dealbreakers: 1) Active addiction, 2) Dishonesty, 3) Faith mismatch.
Top Dealbreakers: 1) Smoking, 2) Bad with money, 3) No ambition.

fields.label: Why are these your top concerns?

q12.title: Things You Should Disclose
q12.prompt: Of the following, which apply to you right now? (This isn't about shame—it's about giving someone the chance to accept the real you.)
examples: Yes (e.g., I see no major red flags).
Maybe (e.g., one or two yellow flags).
No (e.g., I am ignoring something big).

options.label: Active mental health challenge (anxiety, depression, etc.)
Children they may not know about
Trauma that affects intimacy or trust

q13.title: Sexual Integrity Check
q13.prompt: Being honest with yourself: Are you currently living in alignment with your own values around sexual integrity?" *(This adapts to your faith context—we're not here to judge, just to help you be honest with yourself.)*
examples: They are consistent (e.g., words match actions).
They are vague (e.g., hard to pin down plans).
They are intense (e.g., moving very fast).

options.label: I don't have a strong standard on this
No—but I'm actively working on it with support
No—and I'm not actively addressing it
Unsure what my standard even is

fields.label: If you're working on this, what support do you have?
Anything you want to add (kept confidential)

q14.title: Intimacy Timeline Expectations
q14.prompt: For physical intimacy, what's your honest expectation or boundary at this stage?

options.label: Slow and gradual as trust builds
No strong timeline—going with the flow
Open to sooner if it feels right

fields.label: What would help you feel safe and respected in this area?

q15.title: Pornography & Compulsive Behavior
q15.prompt: Does pornography or compulsive sexual behavior currently affect your ability to date with integrity?
examples: Aligned (e.g., we want the same things).
Misaligned (e.g., they want casual, I want serious).

options.label: No—this isn't an issue for me

q16.title: What You're Hesitant to Share
q16.prompt: Is there anything you know you should probably share with this person at some point—but you're hesitant to? (You don't have to share it here, just acknowledge it to yourself.)
examples: My divorce involved infidelity on my part. I've done a lot of work, but they deserve to know eventually.
I have more debt than people might assume. It's manageable but should be disclosed.

q17.title: When You Feel Rejected or Dismissed
q17.prompt: When you feel rejected, dismissed, or like you're not a priority—what do you actually do? (Not what you wish you did.)

options.label: Act like I don't care (mask it)
Test them to see if they'll pursue
Ask to talk about it directly
Takes a bit (up to a day)
It lingers and affects me for a while

fields.label: What response from them would actually help?

q18.title: When You're Stressed
q18.prompt: When you're stressed (work, life, overwhelm), how do you treat the people closest to you? Be honest.

fields.label: What should someone close to you know about stressed-you?
Early warning signs that you're reaching capacity?

q19.title: What Your Ex Would Say
q19.prompt: If I asked your ex (or someone who's been close to you) what was the hardest part about being with you—what would they honestly say?

q20.title: A Behavior You've Been Told Is Hurtful
q20.prompt: Is there a behavior you've been told hurts people—but you struggle to change? (Not looking for perfection, just honesty.)

q21.title: Disappointment Response
q21.prompt: When someone doesn't meet your expectations, how do you typically respond?

options.label: I hint and expect them to notice
I hold it in and it turns to resentment
I lower my expectations and move on
I get critical or vocal about it

q22.title: Emotional Bonding Speed
q22.prompt: How quickly do you tend to bond emotionally? And what causes you to pull back?

options.label: Nothing usually causes me to pull back

fields.label: Anything else to know about your bonding pattern?

q23.title: Reassurance Needs
q23.prompt: What does reassurance look like for you? And how often do you need it to feel secure?

options.label: Clear words ('I like you, I'm here')
Depends on the stage / my stress level

q24.title: When Someone Gets Close
q24.prompt: When someone starts getting closer emotionally, what's your most common response?

options.label: Test them to see if they're safe
Overgive / try to earn their closeness

q25.title: Biggest Fear If This Goes Well
q25.prompt: This might sound strange, but: What are you most afraid will happen if this actually goes well?
examples: That I'll lose my independence. I've worked hard to be okay alone.
That they'll see the real me and be disappointed.
That I'll mess it up somehow like I always do.

q26.title: Hard Conversation Preferences
q26.prompt: When we need to talk about something hard, what helps you engage rather than shut down?

options.label: Write it out first, then talk
Give me time to process before responding
When we're both calm and rested

q27.title: After Conflict, How Quickly Can You Repair?
q27.prompt: After a conflict, how quickly can you usually reconnect and repair?

options.label: Depends heavily on the other person

q28.title: What Makes Feedback Hard to Receive
q28.prompt: What makes feedback hard for you to receive?

options.label: Feels like an attack on my character
No acknowledgment of what I'm doing right

q29.title: A Topic You Avoid
q29.prompt: Is there a topic you tend to avoid in relationships—even when it needs to be discussed? Why?
examples: Money. I grew up poor and feel ashamed talking about finances.
Sex. Past trauma makes it hard to initiate these conversations.

q30.title: Faith / Spirituality Profile
q30.prompt: What role does faith or spirituality play in your life right now?

fields.label: Anything you want to add about your faith journey?

q31.title: Non-Negotiable Values
q31.prompt: What are your non-negotiable values in a relationship? Select and rank your top 5.

fields.label: Why are these most important right now?

q32.title: One Value You'd Compromise vs. One You Wouldn't
q32.prompt: What's a value you could be flexible on—and what's one you absolutely couldn't?

q33.title: Faith-Specific Commitments (Conditional)
q33.prompt: If your faith includes specific commitments or standards that affect dating, how clear and steady are you with them?
examples: Yes (e.g., we want the same family life).
No (e.g., one wants kids, one doesn't).

options.label: Clear and aligned—I can live what I believe
Not clear yet—still sorting it out

fields.label: Name 1-3 commitments you hope to keep (e.g., no sex, worship weekly)

q34.title: Where Faith Gets Complicated
q34.prompt: Is there anything about your faith or beliefs that gets complicated in dating? (Doubt, changing beliefs, interfaith considerations, etc.)
examples: I'm LDS but have questions about some doctrines. I'm still committed but need a partner who can hold space for questions.
I'm more devout than most people I meet. Finding someone who matches my practice level is hard.

q35.title: What Are You Dating Toward?
q35.prompt: What are you dating toward right now?

options.label: Committed relationship (not sure about marriage yet)
Sooner than later (0-12 months to serious commitment)

q36.title: Exclusivity & Labels
q36.prompt: At what point would you want exclusivity and labels?

options.label: After we know there's something real (1-3 months)
Slowly—I need time to be sure (3+ months)
When we've had a direct conversation about it
Fine early on until we discuss exclusivity
I prefer we focus on each other from the start
Depends on how quickly we click

fields.label: What would you want to know from them about this?

q37.title: Physical Pacing
q37.prompt: For physical intimacy, what pace feels right to you at this stage?

options.label: Take it very slow by default

fields.label: How do you want to handle if we're not aligned?

q38.title: Introducing Family/Friends
q38.prompt: When would you want to start introducing each other to close friends or family?

options.label: Early—I like getting input from people I trust
After a few months of dating
When it's clearly heading toward serious
Yes, definitely want kids (or more kids)

fields.label: How does your kids situation affect dating?

q40.title: Time Availability
q40.prompt: Realistically, how much time and energy do you have for a relationship right now?

options.label: Plenty—this is a priority for me
Moderate—I can make time but life is busy
It varies a lot week to week

q41.title: Financial Reality
q41.prompt: How would you describe your financial situation right now?

options.label: Stable but I need to be careful

q42.title: Other Major Constraints
q42.prompt: Are there any other major life constraints that would affect this relationship? (Health, caregiving, career demands, location, etc.)
examples: I'm primary caregiver for an aging parent—my time is limited.
My job might require relocation in the next year.

q43.title: Top Growth Areas
q43.prompt: What are the top 3 things you're actively working to grow or improve in yourself right now?

fields.label: What does growth look like for you right now?

q44.title: What They Need to Know to Love You Well
q44.prompt: What does this person need to know to love you well? Not what you want them to know—what they actually need.

fields.label: The most important thing they need to know

options.label: I need direct communication—I don't pick up hints
I need space after conflict before I can repair
I need reassurance—I can get anxious easily
I need independence—too much togetherness overwhelms me
I need quality time—I feel loved through presence
I need gentleness—harsh tones shut me down

fields.label: Describe what they need to know to love you well
What approach definitely doesn't work with you?

q45.title: What Would Make You Walk Away
q45.prompt: What would make you call this off early—even if you liked them?
examples: If I sensed dishonesty about something important, even once.
If they were unkind to strangers or service workers.
If they pushed physical boundaries after I said no.

q46.title: Readiness Self-Assessment
q46.prompt: On a scale of 1-10, how ready are you for a committed relationship right now?

fields.label: Does this reflect how you are right now, or how you usually are?

q47.title: What You're Hoping For
q47.prompt: In one honest sentence: What are you hoping for with this specific person?

q48.title: If This Doesn't Work
q48.prompt: If this doesn't work out, what will you take away from it?

lite.title: Lite
lite.post_timebox_activity: Take a break before continuing or comparing with your partner.

full.title: Full
full.post_timebox_activity: Take a longer break. This was deep work.
